questions.question: Which macronutrient provides 4 calories per gram?
questions.explanation: Proteins provide 4 calories per gram, same as carbohydrates, while fats provide 9 calories per gram.
questions.funFact: Protein helps build and repair body tissues!

questions.question: Which vitamin is primarily obtained from sunlight exposure?
questions.explanation: Vitamin D is synthesized in the skin when exposed to sunlight, making it the 'sunshine vitamin'.
questions.funFact: Just 15 minutes of sunlight can boost your vitamin D levels!

questions.question: Which mineral is essential for healthy bones and teeth?
questions.explanation: Calcium is the primary mineral that strengthens bones and teeth throughout life.
questions.funFact: 99% of your body's calcium is stored in bones!

questions.question: Which Indian lentil is highest in protein content?
questions.explanation: Urad dal contains approximately 25g protein per 100g, making it the protein-richest among common Indian lentils.
questions.funFact: Urad dal is used to make crispy dosas and vadas!

questions.question: Eating late at night always causes weight gain.
questions.explanation: Weight gain depends on total daily calorie intake, not the timing. Late-night eating may lead to poor food choices, but timing itself isn't the cause.
questions.funFact: Your body burns calories 24/7, even while sleeping!

questions.question: What percentage of human body weight is water in adults?
questions.explanation: Approximately 60-70% of adult body weight is water, varying with age, gender, and body composition.
questions.funFact: Your brain is about 75% water!

questions.question: Which Indian sweet is made primarily from condensed milk?
questions.explanation: Barfi is traditionally made from condensed milk (khoya) and sugar, creating its dense, fudge-like texture.
questions.funFact: Barfi comes in dozens of flavors from pistachio to coconut!

questions.question: What is the recommended daily fiber intake for adults?
questions.explanation: Adults should consume 25-30 grams of dietary fiber daily for optimal digestive health and disease prevention.
questions.funFact: Fiber helps you feel full longer and aids weight management!

questions.question: Which cooking oil is best for deep frying due to its high smoke point?
questions.explanation: Groundnut (peanut) oil has a high smoke point around 230Â°C, making it ideal for deep frying without breaking down.
questions.funFact: Using the right oil prevents harmful compound formation!

questions.question: Which Indian spice is known for its powerful antioxidant curcumin?
questions.explanation: Turmeric contains curcumin, a compound with strong anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
questions.funFact: Black pepper enhances curcumin absorption by 2000%!

questions.question: Which vitamin enhances iron absorption from plant sources?
questions.explanation: Vitamin C significantly improves the absorption of non-heme iron found in plant-based foods.
questions.funFact: Pairing dal with lemon juice boosts iron uptake!

questions.question: Which Indian snack is made from roasted chickpeas?
questions.explanation: Chana jor garam is made from flattened, roasted chickpeas seasoned with spices, providing protein and fiber.
questions.funFact: Roasted chickpeas are a healthier alternative to fried snacks!

questions.question: What is the WHO recommended limit for daily added sugar intake?
questions.explanation: WHO recommends limiting added sugars to less than 10% of total daily calorie intake, ideally below 5%.
questions.funFact: That's about 6 teaspoons for a 2000-calorie diet!

questions.question: Which Indian fermented food is rich in probiotics?
questions.explanation: Dahi (curd) contains live bacterial cultures that support gut health and digestion.
questions.funFact: Probiotics in dahi improve lactose digestion!

questions.question: Which has the lowest glycemic index?
questions.explanation: Brown rice has the lowest glycemic index due to its fiber content, causing a slower rise in blood sugar.
questions.funFact: Low GI foods help maintain steady energy levels!

questions.question: Which type of fish is richest in omega-3 fatty acids?
questions.explanation: Salmon contains the highest concentration of omega-3 fatty acids, particularly EPA and DHA.
questions.funFact: Omega-3s reduce inflammation and support brain health!

questions.question: Carbohydrates are inherently bad for weight loss.
questions.explanation: Carbohydrates aren't inherently bad; complex carbs from whole grains provide energy and nutrients essential for health.
questions.funFact: Your brain needs carbs to function optimally!

questions.question: Which Indian food combination provides complete protein?
questions.explanation: Rice and dal together provide all nine essential amino acids, forming a complete protein.
questions.funFact: This classic combo is nutritionally brilliant!

questions.question: Deficiency of which vitamin causes night blindness?
questions.explanation: Vitamin A is essential for producing rhodopsin, a pigment necessary for seeing in low light conditions.
questions.funFact: Carrots and sweet potatoes are rich in vitamin A!

questions.question: Which sweet is made by deep-frying batter in pretzel shapes and soaking in sugar syrup?
questions.explanation: Jalebi is made by deep-frying fermented batter in spiral shapes and then soaking in sugar syrup.
questions.funFact: Jalebi is believed to have originated in Persia!

questions.question: Which type of cholesterol is considered 'good' cholesterol?
questions.explanation: HDL (High-Density Lipoprotein) is considered 'good' cholesterol as it helps remove other forms of cholesterol from the bloodstream.
questions.funFact: Exercise can increase your HDL levels!

questions.question: Which Indian dairy product has the highest calcium content?
questions.explanation: Paneer (cottage cheese) has concentrated calcium content, with approximately 200mg per 100g serving.
questions.funFact: Paneer provides protein and calcium in one package!

questions.question: What is the maximum daily sodium intake recommended by WHO?
questions.explanation: WHO recommends less than 2 grams of sodium (equivalent to 5 grams of salt) per day for adults.
questions.funFact: Most processed foods contain hidden sodium!

questions.question: Which Indian snack is made from puffed rice?
questions.explanation: Murmura is puffed rice that's often used in bhel puri and as a light snack when roasted with spices.
questions.funFact: Puffed rice is very low in calories and fat!

questions.question: Which factor most significantly affects Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR)?
questions.explanation: Muscle mass significantly affects BMR because muscle tissue burns more calories at rest than fat tissue.
questions.funFact: Building muscle helps you burn more calories 24/7!

questions.question: Which nutrient is especially important for pregnant women to prevent neural tube defects?
questions.explanation: Folic acid (folate) is crucial during pregnancy to prevent neural tube defects in developing babies.
questions.funFact: Green leafy vegetables are excellent folate sources!

questions.question: Which Indian grain is gluten-free?
questions.explanation: Ragi (finger millet) is naturally gluten-free and rich in calcium and iron.
questions.funFact: Ragi is perfect for people with celiac disease!

questions.question: Eating eggs increases blood cholesterol levels significantly.
questions.explanation: Dietary cholesterol from eggs has minimal impact on blood cholesterol for most people; saturated and trans fats have more influence.
questions.funFact: One egg provides 6g of high-quality protein!

questions.question: Which population group is most at risk for vitamin B12 deficiency?
questions.explanation: Vitamin B12 is primarily found in animal products, making vegetarians and vegans particularly vulnerable to deficiency.
questions.funFact: B12 fortified foods and supplements are essential for vegans!

questions.question: Which traditional Indian drink is made from yogurt and water?
questions.explanation: Chaas (buttermilk) is made by diluting yogurt with water and adding spices, providing probiotics and hydration.
questions.funFact: Chaas aids digestion and cools the body in summer!

questions.question: What does one serving of cooked rice typically equal?
questions.explanation: One standard serving of cooked rice is approximately half a cup, containing about 100-120 calories.
questions.funFact: Using smaller plates helps with portion control!

questions.question: What gives tomatoes their red color and antioxidant properties?
questions.explanation: Lycopene is a powerful antioxidant that gives tomatoes their characteristic red color.
questions.funFact: Cooking tomatoes increases lycopene availability!

questions.question: Which Indian sweet is made from gram flour (besan) and ghee?
questions.explanation: Mysore pak is a rich sweet made from gram flour, ghee, and sugar, originating from Karnataka.
questions.funFact: Mysore pak was created in the Mysore Palace kitchens!

questions.question: Which compound in tea and coffee reduces iron absorption?
questions.explanation: Tannins in tea and coffee bind to iron, reducing its absorption by up to 60% when consumed with meals.
questions.funFact: Wait an hour after meals before drinking tea!

questions.question: Which snack is made from fermented batter and steamed?
questions.explanation: Dhokla is made from fermented gram flour batter and is steamed, making it a healthier snack option.
questions.funFact: Dhokla is low in fat and high in protein!

questions.question: Which gland requires iodine for hormone production?
questions.explanation: The thyroid gland needs iodine to produce thyroid hormones that regulate metabolism.
questions.funFact: Iodized salt helps prevent goiter!

questions.question: Drinking cold water after meals causes fat deposits.
questions.explanation: Water temperature doesn't affect fat digestion or deposition; your body adjusts water to body temperature before digestion.
questions.funFact: Drink water at any temperature that's comfortable!

questions.question: Which component is removed from whole wheat to make white flour?
questions.explanation: The bran and germ are removed during refining, eliminating most of the fiber, vitamins, and minerals.
questions.funFact: Whole wheat retains 25% more protein than white flour!

questions.question: Which Indian leafy green has the highest iron content?
questions.explanation: Amaranth leaves contain approximately 5.6mg iron per 100g, highest among common Indian greens.
questions.funFact: Amaranth leaves are also rich in vitamin C!

questions.question: Which protein in wheat causes celiac disease?
questions.explanation: Gluten triggers an autoimmune response in people with celiac disease, damaging the small intestine.
questions.funFact: About 1% of the global population has celiac disease!

questions.question: Which spiced tea is known for its digestive properties?
questions.explanation: Masala chai contains spices like ginger, cardamom, and cinnamon that aid digestion and boost immunity.
questions.funFact: Each household has its own masala chai recipe!

questions.question: How much caffeine does a typical cup of coffee contain?
questions.explanation: A standard 8-ounce cup of coffee contains approximately 95-100mg of caffeine, varying by brewing method.
questions.funFact: Caffeine peaks in your bloodstream within 45 minutes!

questions.question: Which method of food preservation retains the most nutrients?
questions.explanation: Freezing preserves most nutrients by slowing down enzymatic reactions without applying heat.
questions.funFact: Frozen vegetables can be more nutritious than fresh ones stored for days!

questions.question: Which sweet is made from chhena (cottage cheese) soaked in sugar syrup?
questions.explanation: Rasgulla is made from chhena balls boiled and soaked in light sugar syrup, originating from West Bengal.
questions.funFact: Rasgulla means 'syrup-filled ball' in Bengali!

questions.question: Which type of fat is most beneficial for heart health?
questions.explanation: Monounsaturated fats, found in olive oil and nuts, help reduce bad cholesterol and support heart health.
questions.funFact: Olive oil and avocados are excellent sources!

questions.question: Which snack is made from flattened rice?
questions.explanation: Poha is made from flattened rice flakes and is a popular breakfast and snack option across India.
questions.funFact: Poha is light, easy to digest, and quick to prepare!

questions.question: Eating bananas at night causes cough and cold.
questions.explanation: There's no scientific evidence linking banana consumption timing to respiratory infections; this is a cultural myth.
questions.funFact: Bananas are nutritious any time of day!

questions.question: Which vitamin works with calcium for bone health?
questions.explanation: Vitamin D is essential for calcium absorption and bone mineralization, working synergistically with calcium.
questions.funFact: Without vitamin D, only 10-15% of calcium is absorbed!

questions.question: Which seed used in Indian cooking is richest in omega-3 fatty acids?
questions.explanation: Flax seeds contain the highest plant-based omega-3 content, with about 22g per 100g serving.
questions.funFact: Grind flax seeds fresh for maximum benefit!

questions.question: What is the normal fasting blood glucose level?
questions.explanation: Normal fasting blood glucose is 70-100 mg/dL; 100-125 mg/dL indicates prediabetes.
questions.funFact: Regular exercise helps maintain healthy blood sugar levels!

questions.question: Which cooling summer drink is made with raw mango?
questions.explanation: Aam panna is made from raw mangoes, mint, and spices, providing hydration and preventing heat stroke.
questions.funFact: Aam panna is rich in vitamin C and electrolytes!

questions.question: Which mineral is crucial for immune function and wound healing?
questions.explanation: Zinc is essential for immune system function, wound healing, DNA synthesis, and cell division.
questions.funFact: Pumpkin seeds are an excellent zinc source!

questions.question: Which crispy snack is made from rice flour and lentil flour?
questions.explanation: Papad is a thin crispy disc made from rice, lentil, or chickpea flour, sun-dried and roasted or fried.
questions.funFact: Roasted papad is healthier than fried!

questions.question: Drinking milk after eating fish causes skin diseases.
questions.explanation: This is a myth with no scientific basis; milk and fish can be consumed together without health risks.
questions.funFact: Many cuisines combine fish and dairy successfully!

questions.question: What does 'RDA' stand for on nutrition labels?
questions.explanation: RDA (Recommended Dietary Allowance) indicates the daily intake level sufficient to meet nutrient requirements.
questions.funFact: RDA varies by age, gender, and life stage!

questions.question: Which festival sweet is made from grated carrots cooked in milk?
questions.explanation: Gajar ka halwa is made from grated carrots slow-cooked in milk, ghee, and sugar, popular during winters.
questions.funFact: Gajar ka halwa is rich in beta-carotene!

questions.question: Which vitamin acts as an antioxidant protecting cells from damage?
questions.explanation: Vitamin E is a powerful antioxidant that protects cell membranes from oxidative damage.
questions.funFact: Nuts and seeds are excellent vitamin E sources!

questions.question: Which traditional Indian preparation uses sprouted grains?
questions.explanation: Misal uses sprouted moth beans or mixed sprouts, increasing protein digestibility and nutrient availability.
questions.funFact: Sprouting increases vitamin C content by up to 600%!

questions.question: Which Indian cooking fat traditionally contains zero trans fats?
questions.explanation: Pure ghee contains no trans fats, unlike vanaspati and dalda which are partially hydrogenated.
questions.funFact: Traditional ghee is made by clarifying butter!

questions.question: What is the biological value of egg protein?
questions.explanation: Egg protein has a biological value of 100, meaning it contains all essential amino acids in optimal proportions.
questions.funFact: Eggs are the gold standard for protein quality!

questions.question: Which South Indian snack is made from fermented rice and black gram?
questions.explanation: Idli is made from fermented rice and black gram batter, steamed into fluffy cakes that are easily digestible.
questions.funFact: Fermentation increases B-vitamin content in idlis!

questions.question: Brown sugar is significantly healthier than white sugar.
questions.explanation: Brown sugar contains minimal additional nutrients; both types have similar caloric and glycemic effects.
questions.funFact: Brown sugar is often just white sugar with molasses!

questions.question: Which mineral helps in muscle relaxation and nerve function?
questions.explanation: Magnesium is crucial for muscle relaxation, nerve transmission, and over 300 enzymatic reactions.
questions.funFact: Dark chocolate and almonds are rich in magnesium!

questions.question: Which refreshing drink is made with cumin, mint, and black salt?
questions.explanation: Jaljeera is a tangy drink made with cumin, mint, and black salt, known for its digestive properties.
questions.funFact: Jaljeera helps cool the body and stimulates appetite!

questions.question: Which Indian grain has the lowest glycemic index?
questions.explanation: Barley has a glycemic index of 28, lowest among common Indian grains, making it ideal for diabetes management.
questions.funFact: Barley water is traditionally used for health benefits!

questions.question: Which sweet is spherical and made from milk solids deep-fried and soaked in syrup?
questions.explanation: Gulab jamun is made from milk solids (khoya) formed into balls, deep-fried, and soaked in rose-flavored syrup.
questions.funFact: Gulab jamun means 'rose berry' in Persian!

questions.question: At what temperature should cooked food be stored in the refrigerator?
questions.explanation: Cooked food should be stored below 5Â°C (41Â°F) to prevent bacterial growth and maintain food safety.
questions.funFact: The danger zone for bacterial growth is 5-60Â°C!

questions.question: Which Indian vegetable has the highest vitamin C content?
questions.explanation: Capsicum contains approximately 80-120mg vitamin C per 100g, highest among common Indian vegetables.
questions.funFact: Red capsicum has more vitamin C than green!

questions.question: Honey never spoils and can be stored forever.
questions.explanation: Pure honey has natural preservative properties due to low moisture and acidic pH, making it shelf-stable indefinitely.
questions.funFact: Honey found in Egyptian tombs was still edible after 3000 years!

questions.question: Which snack is made from deep-fried triangular pastry filled with potatoes?
questions.explanation: Samosa is a triangular pastry filled with spiced potatoes and peas, deep-fried until crispy.
questions.funFact: Samosas originated in the Middle East before arriving in India!

questions.question: Which electrolyte helps regulate blood pressure?
questions.explanation: Potassium helps regulate blood pressure by counteracting sodium's effects and relaxing blood vessel walls.
questions.funFact: Bananas and coconut water are rich in potassium!

questions.question: Which fermentation process creates dosa batter?
questions.explanation: Lactic acid fermentation by bacteria makes dosa batter rise and adds its characteristic tangy flavor.
questions.funFact: Fermentation makes dosa more digestible and nutritious!

questions.question: Which sweet yogurt-based drink is popular in North India?
questions.explanation: Lassi is a sweet or savory yogurt-based drink, often flavored with fruits or spices, popular in Punjab.
questions.funFact: Mango lassi is enjoyed worldwide!

questions.question: What does the code 'E number' represent on food labels?
questions.explanation: E numbers are codes for food additives approved for use in the European Union and many other countries.
questions.funFact: Not all E numbers are artificial; some are natural like E300 (vitamin C)!

questions.question: Which sweet is made from khoya shaped into round balls?
questions.explanation: Peda is made from khoya (reduced milk solids) shaped into flat, round discs, often flavored with cardamom.
questions.funFact: Mathura peda is the most famous variety!

questions.question: Eating citrus fruits on an empty stomach causes acidity.
questions.explanation: Citrus fruits are generally safe on an empty stomach; individual tolerance varies but they don't inherently cause acidity issues.
questions.funFact: Lemon water is often recommended first thing in the morning!

questions.question: What is the recommended gap between dinner and sleep?
questions.explanation: A 2-3 hour gap allows for proper digestion and prevents acid reflux and sleep disturbances.
questions.funFact: Late heavy meals can disrupt sleep quality!

questions.question: Which Indian spice helps regulate blood sugar levels?
questions.explanation: Fenugreek seeds contain soluble fiber and compounds that help slow carbohydrate absorption and improve insulin sensitivity.
questions.funFact: Soaking fenugreek overnight increases its benefits!

questions.question: Which vitamins are fat-soluble?
questions.explanation: Vitamins A, D, E, and K are fat-soluble, requiring dietary fat for absorption and storage in body tissues.
questions.funFact: Fat-soluble vitamins can be stored in your body for months!

questions.question: Which roasted snack is made from peanuts and spices?
questions.explanation: Masala peanuts are roasted or fried peanuts coated with spicy gram flour batter, providing protein and healthy fats.
questions.funFact: Peanuts are technically legumes, not nuts!

questions.question: Which mineral is important for thyroid hormone metabolism?
questions.explanation: Selenium is essential for converting thyroid hormone T4 to its active form T3 through selenoenzymes.
questions.funFact: Brazil nuts are the richest dietary selenium source!

questions.question: Which traditional drink is made with milk, nuts, and saffron for festivals?
questions.explanation: Thandai is a festive drink made with milk, almonds, pistachios, saffron, and spices, popular during Holi.
questions.funFact: Thandai has cooling properties perfect for summer festivals!

questions.question: Skipping breakfast slows down metabolism significantly.
questions.explanation: While breakfast can be beneficial, skipping it doesn't significantly slow metabolism; total daily calorie intake matters more.
questions.funFact: Meal timing is less important than overall diet quality!

questions.question: Which Bengali sweet is made from chhena and coated with coconut?
questions.explanation: Sandesh is a delicate Bengali sweet made from chhena and sugar, often garnished with pistachios or coconut.
questions.funFact: Sandesh comes in over 100 varieties!

questions.question: Which Indian pulse is easiest to digest?
questions.explanation: Moong dal is the lightest and most easily digestible pulse, often recommended for babies and during illness.
questions.funFact: Moong dal is used in traditional Ayurvedic cleansing diets!

questions.question: Which trace mineral enhances insulin action?
questions.explanation: Chromium enhances insulin sensitivity and helps regulate blood sugar by facilitating glucose uptake into cells.
questions.funFact: Broccoli and whole grains are good chromium sources!

questions.question: Which crispy South Indian snack is spiral-shaped?
questions.explanation: Murukku is a spiral-shaped crispy snack made from rice flour and urad dal flour, popular during festivals.
questions.funFact: Murukku means 'twisted' in Tamil!

questions.question: Which mineral is essential for red blood cell formation along with iron?
questions.explanation: Copper works with iron in hemoglobin synthesis and is essential for iron absorption and utilization.
questions.funFact: Storing water in copper vessels adds trace copper!

questions.question: Organic foods are always more nutritious than conventional foods.
questions.explanation: Organic and conventional foods have similar nutritional content; the main difference is in pesticide exposure and farming methods.
questions.funFact: Organic farming focuses on environmental sustainability!

questions.question: Which drink is made by boiling milk with almonds?
questions.explanation: Badam milk is made by blending soaked almonds with milk and sweetener, providing calcium and healthy fats.
questions.funFact: Almonds boost brain health and memory!

questions.question: Which sweet is made from semolina cooked with ghee and sugar?
questions.explanation: Sooji halwa is made from roasted semolina cooked with ghee, sugar, and water, often garnished with nuts.
questions.funFact: Halwa is offered as prasad in many temples!

questions.question: Which type of fiber feeds beneficial gut bacteria?
questions.explanation: Prebiotic fiber serves as food for beneficial gut bacteria, promoting a healthy gut microbiome.
questions.funFact: Onions, garlic, and bananas are rich in prebiotics!

questions.question: Which Indian preparation uses gram flour as the main ingredient?
questions.explanation: Besan chilla (gram flour pancake) is a protein-rich, gluten-free dish made from chickpea flour.
questions.funFact: Besan chilla is naturally gluten-free and high in protein!

questions.question: Which vegetable contains natural nitrates that improve blood flow?
questions.explanation: Beetroot contains dietary nitrates that convert to nitric oxide, improving blood flow and lowering blood pressure.
questions.funFact: Athletes drink beet juice for enhanced performance!

questions.question: Which snack is made by puffing grains like rice or corn?
questions.explanation: Murmura (puffed rice) is made by heating rice under pressure, creating a light, crispy snack.
questions.funFact: Puffed rice is used in bhel puri and chivda!

questions.question: Drinking water while eating dilutes digestive juices and harms digestion.
questions.explanation: Drinking moderate amounts of water with meals doesn't significantly dilute digestive juices or impair digestion.
questions.funFact: Water actually aids digestion by helping break down food!

questions.question: Which mineral works with calcium for bone health?
questions.explanation: Phosphorus combines with calcium to form hydroxyapatite, the mineral component of bones and teeth.
questions.funFact: 85% of body phosphorus is found in bones!

questions.question: Which sweet is made from rice cooked in milk and flavored with cardamom?
questions.explanation: Kheer is a traditional rice pudding made by slow-cooking rice in milk with sugar and cardamom.
questions.funFact: Kheer is one of the oldest Indian desserts!

questions.question: Which carotenoid is converted to vitamin A in the body?
questions.explanation: Beta-carotene is a provitamin A carotenoid that the body converts to vitamin A as needed.
questions.funFact: Carrots get their orange color from beta-carotene!

questions.question: Which Indian vegetable is known as 'lady's finger' in English?
questions.explanation: Bhindi (okra) is rich in fiber, vitamin C, and folate, with mucilage that aids digestion.
questions.funFact: Okra's mucilage helps soothe the digestive tract!

questions.question: What is the recommended duration to chew each bite of food?
questions.explanation: Chewing each bite 25-30 times aids digestion, increases nutrient absorption, and promotes satiety.
questions.funFact: Proper chewing reduces bloating and improves satisfaction!

questions.question: Which snack is made from deep-fried gram flour vermicelli?
questions.explanation: Sev is thin, crispy vermicelli made from gram flour, commonly used in chaat and eaten as a snack.
questions.funFact: Sev comes in various thicknesses from fine to thick!

questions.question: Microwaving food destroys all nutrients.
questions.explanation: Microwaving can actually preserve nutrients better than some methods due to shorter cooking times and less water usage.
questions.funFact: Microwave cooking often retains more vitamin C than boiling!

questions.question: Which refreshing drink is made from lemon juice, water, and salt?
questions.explanation: Shikanji or nimbu pani is a simple lemonade with salt and sugar, providing hydration and electrolytes.
questions.funFact: Nimbu pani is perfect for rehydration in hot weather!

questions.question: Which B vitamin is important for healthy hair and nails?
questions.explanation: Biotin (vitamin B7) is essential for keratin production, supporting healthy hair, skin, and nails.
questions.funFact: Eggs and nuts are excellent biotin sources!

questions.question: Which sweet is made by shaping khoya and dipping it in sugar syrup?
questions.explanation: Chum chum is an oval-shaped sweet made from chhena or khoya, cooked and soaked in sugar syrup.
questions.funFact: Chum chum is often coated with coconut flakes!

questions.question: Which bitter vegetable is known to help manage blood sugar?
questions.explanation: Bitter gourd contains compounds that mimic insulin and help lower blood glucose levels.
questions.funFact: Karela juice is a traditional diabetes remedy!

questions.question: Which vitamins cannot be stored in the body and need daily intake?
questions.explanation: B-complex vitamins and vitamin C are water-soluble and excreted daily, requiring regular dietary intake.
questions.funFact: Excess water-soluble vitamins are excreted in urine!

questions.question: Which snack is made from roasted foxnuts?
questions.explanation: Makhana (foxnuts/lotus seeds) are low-calorie, protein-rich snacks often roasted with spices.
questions.funFact: Makhana is used in fasting foods and is very nutritious!

questions.question: Eating fat makes you fat.
questions.explanation: Dietary fat doesn't directly cause body fat; excess calories from any source lead to weight gain.
questions.funFact: Healthy fats are essential for hormone production and vitamin absorption!

questions.question: Which sweet is made from roasted gram flour, ghee, and sugar?
questions.explanation: Besan ladoo is made from roasted gram flour mixed with ghee and sugar, shaped into balls.
questions.funFact: Besan ladoo is energy-dense and offered during festivals!

questions.question: Which vitamin is essential for blood clotting?
questions.explanation: Vitamin K is crucial for the synthesis of clotting factors, enabling proper blood coagulation.
questions.funFact: Green leafy vegetables are rich in vitamin K!

questions.question: Which Indian bread is unleavened and made from whole wheat?
questions.explanation: Roti or chapati is an unleavened flatbread made from whole wheat flour, providing fiber and nutrients.
questions.funFact: Roti is a daily staple in most Indian households!

questions.question: Which vitamin is essential for collagen synthesis?
questions.explanation: Vitamin C is a cofactor in collagen synthesis, essential for skin, bone, and connective tissue health.
questions.funFact: Vitamin C deficiency leads to scurvy, a collagen disorder!

questions.question: Which crispy snack is made from thin slices of potato?
questions.explanation: Potato chips are thin slices of potato, deep-fried or baked until crispy, popular worldwide.
questions.funFact: Baked chips have fewer calories than fried versions!

questions.question: Natural sugars from fruits are healthier than added sugars and don't affect blood sugar.
questions.explanation: While fruits contain fiber and nutrients, their natural sugars still affect blood glucose; the fiber slows absorption.
questions.funFact: Whole fruits are better than fruit juice due to fiber content!

questions.question: Which drink is made from tender coconut water?
questions.explanation: Coconut water is the clear liquid inside young coconuts, rich in electrolytes and naturally hydrating.
questions.funFact: Coconut water was used as IV fluid during emergencies!

questions.question: Which sweet is made from grated coconut and jaggery?
questions.explanation: Both coconut barfi and coconut ladoo are made from grated coconut and jaggery or sugar.
questions.funFact: Coconut sweets are popular during Ganesh Chaturthi!

questions.question: Deficiency of which vitamin causes beriberi?
questions.explanation: Thiamine (vitamin B1) deficiency causes beriberi, affecting the cardiovascular and nervous systems.
questions.funFact: Whole grains and legumes are excellent thiamine sources!

questions.question: Which Indian food is made by fermenting rice batter?
questions.explanation: Dhokla, dosa, and uttapam all use fermented rice batter, enhancing digestibility and nutritional value.
questions.funFact: Fermentation increases B-vitamins in these foods!

questions.question: Which vitamin gives a yellowish color to urine when taken in excess?
questions.explanation: Riboflavin (vitamin B2) is bright yellow and colors urine when taken in amounts exceeding body needs.
questions.funFact: This bright yellow color is harmless and normal!

questions.question: Which South Indian snack is a donut-shaped fried fritter?
questions.explanation: Vada (or vadai) is a donut-shaped fritter made from lentil batter, deep-fried until crispy.
questions.funFact: Medu vada is commonly eaten with sambhar and chutney!

questions.question: Eating spicy food causes stomach ulcers.
questions.explanation: Spicy food doesn't cause ulcers; most ulcers are caused by H. pylori bacteria or NSAIDs. Spices may irritate existing ulcers.
questions.funFact: Capsaicin in chilies may actually have protective benefits!

questions.question: How many calories does one medium-sized gulab jamun contain?
questions.explanation: One medium gulab jamun contains approximately 180-200 calories due to its sugar syrup and deep-fried khoya content.
questions.funFact: Two gulab jamuns equal the calories of a full meal!

questions.question: How much protein does one medium chapati (roti) contain?
questions.explanation: One medium whole wheat chapati (30g flour) contains approximately 3-4 grams of protein.
questions.funFact: Pair roti with dal for a complete protein meal!

questions.question: How many calories does one bowl (150g) of cooked white rice contain?
questions.explanation: One bowl (150g) of cooked white rice contains approximately 180-200 calories, primarily from carbohydrates.
questions.funFact: Brown rice has slightly more fiber but similar calories!

questions.question: How much protein is in one bowl (150g) of cooked moong dal?
questions.explanation: One bowl (150g) of cooked moong dal provides approximately 10-12 grams of protein.
questions.funFact: Dal is an excellent vegetarian protein source!

questions.question: How many calories does one piece of kaju barfi contain?
questions.explanation: One medium piece (30g) of kaju barfi contains approximately 120-150 calories from cashews, sugar, and ghee.
questions.funFact: Kaju barfi is calorie-dense due to cashew fat content!

questions.question: Which symptom indicates you are bloated?
questions.explanation: Bloating is characterized by visible abdominal distension, feeling of fullness, tightness, and sometimes discomfort or gas.
questions.funFact: Eating slowly and avoiding carbonated drinks reduces bloating!

questions.question: How many calories does one bowl (100g) of moong dal halwa contain?
questions.explanation: One bowl (100g) of moong dal halwa contains 350-400 calories due to ghee, sugar, and dal content.
questions.funFact: Moong dal halwa is traditionally served during winters for energy!

questions.question: How much protein does one large boiled egg contain?
questions.explanation: One large boiled egg contains approximately 6-7 grams of high-quality protein with all essential amino acids.
questions.funFact: Egg white has protein, yolk has vitamins and healthy fats!

questions.question: How many calories does one samosa contain?
questions.explanation: One medium samosa contains approximately 200-250 calories due to deep-fried pastry and potato filling.
questions.funFact: Baked samosas have 30-40% fewer calories than fried ones!

questions.question: How much fiber does one medium apple with skin contain?
questions.explanation: One medium apple (180g) with skin contains approximately 4 grams of dietary fiber, mostly in the peel.
questions.funFact: Always eat apples with skin for maximum fiber and nutrients!

questions.question: How many calories does one piece of jalebi contain?
questions.explanation: One medium jalebi contains approximately 120-150 calories from refined flour, sugar syrup, and frying oil.
questions.funFact: Jalebis are almost pure sugar and refined carbs!

questions.question: How much protein does 100g of paneer contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of paneer contains approximately 14-18 grams of high-quality protein, making it excellent for vegetarians.
questions.funFact: Paneer is one of the best vegetarian protein sources!

questions.question: Which food group commonly causes bloating due to fermentation?
questions.explanation: Cruciferous vegetables (cabbage, broccoli) and legumes contain complex sugars that ferment in the gut, producing gas.
questions.funFact: Soaking beans before cooking reduces gas-causing compounds!

questions.question: How many calories does one vada contain?
questions.explanation: One medu vada contains approximately 180-220 calories due to lentils and deep frying in oil.
questions.funFact: Pair vada with sambhar for added nutrition and vegetables!

questions.question: How much calcium does one glass (250ml) of milk contain?
questions.explanation: One glass (250ml) of cow's milk provides approximately 300-350mg of calcium, about 30% of daily needs.
questions.funFact: Milk is one of the most bioavailable calcium sources!

questions.question: How many grams of carbohydrates does one bowl (150g) of cooked rice contain?
questions.explanation: One bowl (150g) of cooked white rice contains approximately 40-45 grams of carbohydrates.
questions.funFact: Rice is the primary carbohydrate source for half the world!

questions.question: How many calories does one medium dosa contain?
questions.explanation: One medium plain dosa contains approximately 120-150 calories, varying with oil used and thickness.
questions.funFact: Paper dosa has fewer calories than thick dosa!

questions.question: How much iron does 100g of spinach (palak) contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of raw spinach contains approximately 2.5-3mg of iron, though bioavailability is lower than meat sources.
questions.funFact: Add lemon to spinach to boost iron absorption!

questions.question: What is a common sign of lactose intolerance?
options: Bloating and gas after consuming milk
questions.explanation: Lactose intolerance causes bloating, gas, cramps, and diarrhea within hours of consuming dairy products.
questions.funFact: About 65% of adults have reduced lactase enzyme production!

questions.question: How many calories does one rasgulla contain?
questions.explanation: One medium rasgulla contains approximately 100-120 calories from chhena and sugar syrup.
questions.funFact: Rasgulla has fewer calories than most fried Indian sweets!

questions.question: How much protein does 100g of chicken breast contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of cooked chicken breast contains approximately 28-31 grams of lean, high-quality protein.
questions.funFact: Chicken breast is one of the leanest protein sources!

questions.question: How much fat does one tablespoon of ghee contain?
questions.explanation: One tablespoon (15ml) of ghee contains approximately 14-15 grams of fat, mostly saturated fat.
questions.funFact: Use ghee in moderation for its flavor and fat-soluble vitamins!

questions.question: How many calories does one idli contain?
questions.explanation: One medium idli contains approximately 60-70 calories, making it a light and healthy breakfast option.
questions.funFact: Idlis are steamed, not fried, keeping calories low!

questions.question: How much sodium does one teaspoon of table salt contain?
questions.explanation: One teaspoon (5g) of table salt contains approximately 2300mg of sodium, the entire daily recommended limit.
questions.funFact: Most dietary sodium comes from processed foods, not the salt shaker!

questions.question: Which symptom indicates food is not digesting properly?
questions.explanation: Persistent heartburn, acid reflux, bloating, and undigested food in stool indicate poor digestion.
questions.funFact: Eating slowly and chewing well improves digestion significantly!

questions.question: How many calories does one paratha with ghee contain?
questions.explanation: One medium paratha with ghee contains approximately 280-320 calories from wheat flour, ghee, and oil.
questions.funFact: Stuffed parathas have even more calories depending on filling!

questions.question: How much protein does 100g of tofu contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of tofu contains approximately 8-10 grams of complete plant-based protein from soybeans.
questions.funFact: Tofu is a versatile meat substitute rich in protein!

questions.question: How many calories does one medium banana contain?
questions.explanation: One medium banana (120g) contains approximately 105 calories, primarily from natural sugars and carbohydrates.
questions.funFact: Bananas are perfect pre-workout energy boosters!

questions.question: How much fiber does one bowl (150g) of cooked brown rice contain?
questions.explanation: One bowl (150g) of cooked brown rice contains approximately 2.5-3.5 grams of dietary fiber.
questions.funFact: Brown rice has 3 times more fiber than white rice!

questions.question: How many calories does one ladoo contain?
questions.explanation: One medium besan or boondi ladoo contains approximately 180-220 calories from flour, ghee, and sugar.
questions.funFact: Ladoos are energy-dense festival treats!

questions.question: How can you tell if you're properly hydrated?
questions.explanation: Pale yellow or clear urine indicates proper hydration, while dark yellow suggests you need more water.
questions.funFact: Urine color is the easiest hydration indicator!

questions.question: How much protein does 100g of chickpeas (cooked chana) contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of cooked chickpeas contains approximately 9-11 grams of protein along with fiber and minerals.
questions.funFact: Chickpeas are protein powerhouses for vegetarians!

questions.question: How many calories does one piece of barfi contain?
questions.explanation: One medium piece (30g) of milk barfi contains approximately 120-150 calories from khoya and sugar.
questions.funFact: Different barfi varieties have slightly varying calorie counts!

questions.question: What does frequent constipation indicate?
questions.explanation: Constipation typically indicates insufficient fiber intake, inadequate water consumption, or lack of physical activity.
questions.funFact: Eating fruits, vegetables, and drinking water prevents constipation!

questions.question: How many grams of carbohydrates does one medium chapati contain?
questions.explanation: One medium whole wheat chapati (30g flour) contains approximately 15-18 grams of carbohydrates.
questions.funFact: Whole wheat chapati provides complex carbs for sustained energy!

questions.question: How many calories does one cup of masala chai contain?
questions.explanation: One cup of masala chai with milk and sugar contains approximately 70-90 calories, varying with milk and sugar amounts.
questions.funFact: Chai without sugar has only 30-40 calories!

questions.question: How much calcium does 100g of paneer contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of paneer contains approximately 200-250mg of calcium, making it excellent for bone health.
questions.funFact: Paneer provides both calcium and protein together!

questions.question: How many calories does one plate (200g) of biryani contain?
questions.explanation: One plate (200g) of biryani contains approximately 500-600 calories from rice, meat, oil, and ghee.
questions.funFact: Vegetable biryani has 100-150 fewer calories than meat biryani!

questions.question: How much protein does one cup (240ml) of milk contain?
questions.explanation: One cup (240ml) of whole milk contains approximately 8 grams of high-quality protein.
questions.funFact: Milk protein contains both whey and casein!

questions.question: How many calories does one piece of dhokla contain?
questions.explanation: One medium piece of dhokla contains approximately 80-100 calories, as it's steamed rather than fried.
questions.funFact: Dhokla is a healthy, low-calorie fermented snack!

questions.question: What indicates you may have acid reflux or GERD?
options: Burning sensation in chest after meals
questions.explanation: Burning sensation in the chest (heartburn), sour taste, and regurgitation after meals indicate acid reflux or GERD.
questions.funFact: Avoid lying down within 2-3 hours after meals to prevent reflux!

questions.question: How much fat does 100g of almonds contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of almonds contains approximately 49-50 grams of healthy fats, mostly monounsaturated.
questions.funFact: Almond fats are heart-healthy and help reduce bad cholesterol!

questions.question: How many calories does one medium apple contain?
questions.explanation: One medium apple (180g) contains approximately 95 calories from natural sugars and fiber.
questions.funFact: An apple a day provides fiber and antioxidants!

questions.question: How much iron does 100g of jaggery (gur) contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of jaggery contains approximately 11mg of iron, making it beneficial for anemia prevention.
questions.funFact: Jaggery is a healthier sweetener than white sugar with added minerals!

questions.question: How much protein does 100g of peanuts contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of peanuts contains approximately 25-26 grams of protein along with healthy fats.
questions.funFact: Peanuts are legumes, not true nuts, and are protein-rich!

questions.question: How many calories does one cup of lassi contain?
questions.explanation: One cup of sweet lassi contains approximately 120-150 calories from yogurt and sugar.
questions.funFact: Salted lassi has fewer calories than sweet lassi!

questions.question: What does excessive gas after meals indicate?
options: Eating too fast or food intolerance
questions.explanation: Excessive gas can indicate eating too fast, swallowing air, food intolerance, or consuming gas-producing foods.
questions.funFact: Chewing slowly and avoiding carbonated drinks reduces gas!

questions.question: How many calories does one kachori contain?
questions.explanation: One medium kachori contains approximately 180-220 calories from refined flour, lentil filling, and deep frying.
questions.funFact: Kachoris are calorie-dense due to deep frying in oil!

questions.question: How much fiber does 100g of chickpeas contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of cooked chickpeas contains approximately 12-13 grams of dietary fiber.
questions.funFact: Chickpeas provide both protein and fiber for fullness!

questions.question: How many calories does one boiled egg contain?
questions.explanation: One large boiled egg contains approximately 70-78 calories with 6g protein and healthy fats.
questions.funFact: Eggs are one of the most nutritious foods per calorie!

questions.question: How much potassium does one medium banana contain?
questions.explanation: One medium banana contains approximately 422mg of potassium, supporting heart and muscle function.
questions.funFact: Bananas are excellent post-workout recovery foods!

questions.question: How many calories does one piece of pakora contain?
questions.explanation: One medium vegetable pakora contains approximately 80-100 calories from gram flour batter and deep frying.
questions.funFact: Air-fried pakoras have 50-60% fewer calories!

questions.question: How much protein does one bowl (150g) of rajma (kidney beans) contain?
questions.explanation: One bowl (150g) of cooked rajma contains approximately 10-12 grams of protein and fiber.
questions.funFact: Rajma-chawal is a complete protein combination!

questions.question: What does feeling excessively full after small meals indicate?
questions.explanation: Early satiety and prolonged fullness may indicate slow gastric emptying, gastroparesis, or digestive issues.
questions.funFact: Small, frequent meals help with slow digestion issues!

questions.question: How many calories does one puri contain?
questions.explanation: One medium puri contains approximately 100-120 calories from wheat flour and deep frying in oil.
questions.funFact: Puris absorb significant oil during deep frying!

questions.question: How many grams of carbohydrates does one medium banana contain?
questions.explanation: One medium banana contains approximately 27 grams of carbohydrates, mostly from natural sugars.
questions.funFact: Ripe bananas have more simple sugars than unripe ones!

questions.question: How many calories does one tablespoon of peanut butter contain?
questions.explanation: One tablespoon (16g) of peanut butter contains approximately 95-100 calories from protein and healthy fats.
questions.funFact: Natural peanut butter without added sugar is healthier!

questions.question: How much vitamin C does one medium orange contain?
questions.explanation: One medium orange contains approximately 70mg of vitamin C, about 78% of the daily requirement.
questions.funFact: One orange provides nearly all your daily vitamin C needs!

questions.question: How many calories does one plate of poha contain?
questions.explanation: One plate (150g) of poha contains approximately 180-220 calories depending on oil and peanut quantity used.
questions.funFact: Poha is light, easily digestible, and rich in iron!

questions.question: How much fat does one tablespoon of olive oil contain?
questions.explanation: One tablespoon (15ml) of olive oil contains approximately 14 grams of mostly monounsaturated fat.
questions.funFact: Olive oil is heart-healthy with anti-inflammatory properties!

questions.question: What does sudden diarrhea after eating indicate?
questions.explanation: Sudden diarrhea after eating may indicate food poisoning, food intolerance, IBS, or bacterial infection.
questions.funFact: Stay hydrated and seek medical help if diarrhea persists!

questions.question: How many calories does one piece of mysore pak contain?
questions.explanation: One medium piece (35g) of mysore pak contains approximately 150-180 calories from gram flour and ghee.
questions.funFact: Mysore pak is very rich in ghee, making it calorie-dense!

questions.question: How much protein does 100g of fish contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of cooked fish contains approximately 18-22 grams of lean, high-quality protein.
questions.funFact: Fish provides protein plus heart-healthy omega-3 fats!

questions.question: How much sodium does one serving of pickles (achar) typically contain?
questions.explanation: One serving (30g) of Indian pickles contains approximately 800-1200mg sodium due to heavy salt preservation.
questions.funFact: Limit pickle intake if you have high blood pressure!

questions.question: How many calories does one cup of black coffee contain?
questions.explanation: One cup of black coffee without sugar or milk contains only 2-5 calories, almost negligible.
questions.funFact: Black coffee is virtually calorie-free and boosts metabolism!

questions.question: How much fiber does one medium orange contain?
questions.explanation: One medium orange contains approximately 3 grams of dietary fiber, mostly in the pulp and membranes.
questions.funFact: Eating whole oranges provides more fiber than juice!

questions.question: How many calories does one kulfi contain?
questions.explanation: One medium kulfi (100g) contains approximately 180-220 calories from condensed milk and sugar.
questions.funFact: Kulfi is denser and creamier than regular ice cream!

questions.question: How much calcium does 100g of ragi (finger millet) contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of ragi contains approximately 344mg of calcium, highest among cereals.
questions.funFact: Ragi has 10 times more calcium than rice or wheat!

questions.question: What does yellow or pale stool indicate?
questions.explanation: Pale or clay-colored stools may indicate bile duct obstruction, liver issues, or fat malabsorption.
questions.funFact: Normal stool color is brown due to bile pigments!

questions.question: How many calories does one medium mango contain?
questions.explanation: One medium mango (200g) contains approximately 130-140 calories from natural sugars and carbohydrates.
questions.funFact: Mangoes are rich in vitamin A and C!

questions.question: How much protein does 100g of quinoa (cooked) contain?
questions.explanation: 100 grams of cooked quinoa contains approximately 4-5 grams of complete protein with all essential amino acids.
questions.funFact: Quinoa is a complete plant protein, rare among grains!

questions.question: How many calories does one bhatura contain?
questions.explanation: One medium bhatura contains approximately 220-260 calories from refined flour and deep frying.
questions.funFact: Chole bhature is delicious but very calorie-dense!

questions.question: How much sugar does one can (330ml) of cola contain?
questions.explanation: One can (330ml) of regular cola contains approximately 35-39 grams of sugar, equivalent to 8-9 teaspoons.
questions.funFact: That's more than the entire daily recommended sugar limit!

questions.question: How many calories does one bowl (100g) of upma contain?
questions.explanation: One bowl (100g) of upma contains approximately 150-180 calories from semolina, oil, and vegetables.
questions.funFact: Add more vegetables to upma for extra nutrition!

questions.question: What does foul-smelling gas frequently indicate?
options: High protein diet or poor digestion
questions.explanation: Foul-smelling gas often indicates protein malabsorption, bacterial overgrowth, or digestive issues.
questions.funFact: Probiotics and digestive enzymes can help reduce this issue!

questions.question: How many calories does one piece of rasmalai contain?
questions.explanation: One piece of rasmalai contains approximately 180-220 calories from chhena patties and sweetened milk.
questions.funFact: Rasmalai's milk base provides calcium and protein!

questions.question: True or False: Jaggery contains iron.
questions.explanation: Jaggery is a good source of iron, especially compared to regular sugar, making it beneficial for anemia prevention.
questions.funFact: 100g of jaggery contains approximately 11mg of iron!

questions.question: Spinach (palak) is a rich source of which nutrient?
questions.explanation: Spinach is an excellent source of iron and folate, essential for blood formation and preventing anemia.
questions.funFact: 100g of spinach contains 2.7mg iron and 194mcg folate!

questions.question: Which street food snack is considered high in protein?
questions.explanation: Chana chaat (spiced chickpeas) is rich in protein and fiber, making it a healthier street food option.
questions.funFact: 100g of chickpeas contains 19g protein when dry, 9g when cooked!

questions.question: True or False: Carrots are rich in beta-carotene (Vitamin A).
questions.explanation: Carrots are excellent sources of beta-carotene, which the body converts to vitamin A for eye health.
questions.funFact: 100g of carrots contains 8285mcg of beta-carotene!

questions.question: Which Indian food is the richest source of calcium?
questions.explanation: Ragi is exceptionally rich in calcium, making it excellent for bone health and ideal for growing children.
questions.funFact: 100g of ragi contains 344mg calcium - 10 times more than rice!

questions.question: True or False: Amla (Indian gooseberry) is one of the richest sources of Vitamin C.
questions.explanation: Amla contains exceptionally high vitamin C levels, even more than oranges, making it a superfood for immunity.
questions.funFact: 100g of fresh amla contains 600-700mg of Vitamin C!

questions.question: Which food is an excellent source of potassium for heart health?
questions.explanation: Potatoes are rich in potassium, which helps regulate blood pressure and supports heart function.
questions.funFact: 100g of potato contains 425mg potassium - more than bananas!

questions.question: Which seed is the richest vegetarian source of Omega-3 fatty acids?
questions.explanation: Flax seeds contain the highest plant-based omega-3 content, essential for heart and brain health.
questions.funFact: 100g of flax seeds contains 22.8g of omega-3 fatty acids!

questions.question: True or False: Oats are a rich source of soluble fiber.
questions.explanation: Oats contain beta-glucan, a type of soluble fiber that helps lower cholesterol and improve gut health.
questions.funFact: 100g of oats contains 10g of fiber, including 4g of beta-glucan!

questions.question: Which Indian spice is richest in antioxidants?
questions.explanation: Turmeric contains curcumin, one of the most powerful antioxidants with anti-inflammatory properties.
questions.funFact: 100g of turmeric contains 3-5g of curcumin compounds!

questions.question: True or False: Dark chocolate is a good source of magnesium.
questions.explanation: Dark chocolate (70%+ cocoa) is rich in magnesium, supporting muscle function and reducing stress.
questions.funFact: 100g of dark chocolate contains 228mg magnesium - 57% of daily needs!

questions.question: Which food is an excellent vegetarian source of zinc?
questions.explanation: Pumpkin seeds are one of the best plant-based sources of zinc, essential for immunity and wound healing.
questions.funFact: 100g of pumpkin seeds contains 7.6mg zinc - 69% of daily needs!

questions.question: True or False: Almonds are rich in Vitamin E.
questions.explanation: Almonds are one of the best sources of vitamin E, a powerful antioxidant that protects cells.
questions.funFact: 100g of almonds contains 25.6mg Vitamin E - 171% of daily needs!

questions.question: Which food is the richest source of lycopene?
questions.explanation: Tomatoes are the richest dietary source of lycopene, an antioxidant that protects against certain cancers.
questions.funFact: 100g of cooked tomatoes contains 3.7mg lycopene - cooking increases it!

questions.question: True or False: Curd (dahi) contains beneficial probiotics.
questions.explanation: Curd contains live bacterial cultures that support gut health, digestion, and immunity.
questions.funFact: 100g of fresh curd contains millions of beneficial bacteria!

questions.question: Which leafy green is richest in folate?
questions.explanation: Spinach is exceptionally rich in folate, essential for DNA synthesis and preventing birth defects.
questions.funFact: 100g of spinach contains 194mcg folate - 49% of daily needs!

questions.question: True or False: Brazil nuts are the richest dietary source of selenium.
questions.explanation: Brazil nuts contain extremely high selenium levels, important for thyroid function and antioxidant defense.
questions.funFact: Just one Brazil nut (5g) contains 96mcg selenium - 175% of daily needs!

questions.question: Which food is an excellent source of Vitamin K?
questions.explanation: Spinach and other leafy greens are rich in vitamin K, essential for blood clotting and bone health.
questions.funFact: 100g of spinach contains 483mcg Vitamin K - 402% of daily needs!

questions.question: True or False: Fish is a good source of phosphorus.
questions.explanation: Fish is rich in phosphorus, which works with calcium to build strong bones and teeth.
questions.funFact: 100g of fish contains 200-250mg phosphorus - 20-25% of daily needs!

questions.question: Which food is richest in biotin for hair health?
questions.explanation: Eggs, especially the yolk, are one of the richest sources of biotin, supporting healthy hair and nails.
questions.funFact: One large egg contains 10mcg biotin - 33% of daily needs!

questions.question: True or False: Tea is a good source of manganese.
questions.explanation: Tea, especially black and green tea, contains significant manganese which supports bone health and metabolism.
questions.funFact: One cup of brewed tea contains 0.5mg manganese - 22% of daily needs!

questions.question: Which food is richest in choline for brain health?
questions.explanation: Egg yolks are the richest dietary source of choline, essential for brain development and function.
questions.funFact: One large egg yolk contains 147mg choline - 27% of daily needs!

questions.question: True or False: Cashews are a good source of copper.
questions.explanation: Cashews are rich in copper, which aids in iron absorption and red blood cell formation.
questions.funFact: 100g of cashews contains 2.2mg copper - 244% of daily needs!

questions.question: Which is the most common dietary source of iodine in India?
questions.explanation: Iodized salt is fortified with iodine to prevent thyroid disorders and is the primary iodine source for most Indians.
questions.funFact: One gram of iodized salt contains 15-30mcg iodine!

questions.question: True or False: Blueberries are rich in anthocyanins.
questions.explanation: Blueberries contain high levels of anthocyanins, powerful antioxidants that give them their blue color.
questions.funFact: 100g of blueberries contains 163mg anthocyanins!

questions.question: Which vegetable is rich in sulfur compounds beneficial for detoxification?
questions.explanation: Garlic contains sulfur compounds like allicin that support liver detoxification and boost immunity.
questions.funFact: 100g of garlic contains 330mg of sulfur compounds!

questions.question: True or False: Onions are rich in quercetin, an anti-inflammatory compound.
questions.explanation: Onions, especially red onions, are excellent sources of quercetin, which has anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
questions.funFact: 100g of red onions contains 20-30mg quercetin!

questions.question: Which food is rich in tryptophan that helps improve sleep?
questions.explanation: Pumpkin seeds are rich in tryptophan, an amino acid that converts to serotonin and melatonin for better sleep.
questions.funFact: 100g of pumpkin seeds contains 576mg tryptophan!

questions.question: True or False: Grapes contain resveratrol, a heart-protective compound.
questions.explanation: Grapes, especially red and purple varieties, contain resveratrol which protects the heart and blood vessels.
questions.funFact: 100g of red grapes contains 0.24-1.25mg resveratrol!

questions.question: Which food contains capsaicin that boosts metabolism?
questions.explanation: Green and red chilies contain capsaicin, which increases metabolism and has pain-relieving properties.
questions.funFact: 100g of green chilies contains 0.1-0.2% capsaicin by weight!

questions.question: True or False: Mushrooms contain beta-glucans that boost immunity.
questions.explanation: Mushrooms are rich in beta-glucans, compounds that enhance immune function and reduce inflammation.
questions.funFact: 100g of shiitake mushrooms contains 0.5-1g beta-glucans!

questions.question: Which fruit is richest in pectin, a soluble fiber?
questions.explanation: Apples are rich in pectin, a soluble fiber that lowers cholesterol and supports gut health.
questions.funFact: 100g of apples contains 0.9-1.2g pectin, mostly in the peel!

questions.question: True or False: Garlic contains inulin, a prebiotic fiber.
questions.explanation: Garlic contains inulin, a prebiotic fiber that feeds beneficial gut bacteria and improves digestion.
questions.funFact: 100g of garlic contains 9-16g inulin!

questions.question: Which legume contains saponins that may lower cholesterol?
questions.explanation: Chickpeas contain saponins, plant compounds that may help lower cholesterol and have anti-cancer properties.
questions.funFact: 100g of chickpeas contains 0.3-0.5g saponins!

questions.question: True or False: Spinach contains lutein that protects eye health.
questions.explanation: Spinach is rich in lutein, a carotenoid that protects against age-related macular degeneration and cataracts.
questions.funFact: 100g of spinach contains 12.2mg lutein!

questions.question: Which fruit is richest in ellagic acid, an anti-cancer compound?
questions.explanation: Pomegranate is exceptionally rich in ellagic acid, which has anti-cancer and antioxidant properties.
questions.funFact: 100g of pomegranate contains 80-120mg ellagic acid!

questions.question: True or False: Wheatgrass is extremely rich in chlorophyll.
questions.explanation: Wheatgrass contains very high chlorophyll levels, which has detoxifying and alkalizing properties.
questions.funFact: 100g of wheatgrass contains 700-1000mg chlorophyll!

questions.question: Which fruit contains bromelain, an enzyme that aids protein digestion?
questions.explanation: Pineapple contains bromelain, a proteolytic enzyme that helps digest protein and reduces inflammation.
questions.funFact: 100g of fresh pineapple contains 100-400mg bromelain!

questions.question: True or False: Papaya contains papain enzyme that aids digestion.
questions.explanation: Papaya contains papain, a digestive enzyme that breaks down proteins and soothes the digestive tract.
questions.funFact: 100g of raw papaya contains 5-15mg papain enzyme!

questions.question: Which spice contains gingerol that reduces nausea?
questions.explanation: Ginger contains gingerol, a bioactive compound that effectively reduces nausea, inflammation, and pain.
questions.funFact: 100g of fresh ginger contains 400-1600mg gingerol!
